intro: Panphalea commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's panphalea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native habitat.
